Reviews.Title: “Tiny but convenient hotel ....”
Reviews.Author: 1429a1414
Reviews.Content: Every thing is small in this hotel starting by the elevator .The room are also abit sqeezy...but clean, restroom is spotless an the sleep is very deep...If you have view by the window, it is charming to see Paris...The price is correct and include a good breakfast. We also appreciate the the subway entrance across the parc in front of the hotel and the museum at the left. Any other hotel would interest us but we appreciated our 2 last trip in Paris in this Little Palace.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: omarhafez
Reviews.Content: Central and clean, that's about it... Pricy tiny dark room overpriced

Reviews.Title: “3 day city break”
Reviews.Author: AzureeChichester
Reviews.Content: From start to finish this was a great place to stay, right next to the underground so you could get anywhere easily. Room we had was with balcony, rather small but all French hotels are but spotlessly clean, recently re-furbished, bedding very clean and comfortable. Shower room had just been done and was spotless, modern bang on trend contemporary with Villeroy and Bosch sanitarty ware Staff exceptionally polite nothing was too much trouble . I would definitely stay there again. I am very fussy when it comes to rooms and cleanliness and this ticked all the boxes so well done Little Palace

Reviews.Title: “Great place to chill in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Caroline3000
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel I really enjoyed my stay here, rooms are small but hey that's Paris!!! you can walk to some great cafes and bars just a few steps away...

Reviews.Title: “A great location”
Reviews.Author: supm
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from three nights at The Little Palace and believe it is worthy of a very good review. The location is excellent, we could walk to most places and there are three Metro stations within 5 minutes. The hotel is only three stops to Gare du Nord. The hotel is small but spotlessly clean and overlooks a square which is currently being upgraded. One of our rooms overlooked the square and another, the back of the building. This was gloomy but quiet and gave us no problems whatsoever. The staff were, without exception delightful, friendly and full of good suggestions. Every restaurant or cafe they recommended was spot on. We ate breakfast once which was adequate but we preferred eating out and this was easy to do. A recommendation is one thing and "would we go back" another and the answer is yes we definitely would.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoying X-mas deco in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Xavier D
Reviews.Content: We had a v pleasant break in Paris from Dec 11th till Dec14th. Hotel was v good and the staff v helpful. V central and just a few steps from the Metro . Rooms were small but clean. Neg was the noise you had from the the other rooms. Breakfast was ok .

Reviews.Title: “Another two nights in Golden Tulip Little Palace”
Reviews.Author: JAJORI
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay in Golden Tulip Little Palace in Paris. And again, I enjoyed my stay there. My room was spacious enough with a nice design, the breakfast good, and location great.

Reviews.Title: “very good value”
Reviews.Author: Nippyems
Reviews.Content: As usual, i booked this hotel based on trip advisers boutique listing. I was not dissapointed, good location, taxi from Nord apporx £12 euros. The Reaumur Sebastopol metro (buy a 3 day travel ticket, very good value) was 5 mins from the hotel. I asked for a room on a high floor which they accommodated (83). We could see the eiffel tower from our room which was spectacular lit up for the holidays (buy ticket to use the lifts to the top of the eiffel on line in advance). The room was tiny but i didnt expect anything else, my partner and I had the best nights sleep we have had for a while in the king size bed with the black out curtains. We didnt have breakfast, still asleep! The staff were very helpful, ordering us a taxi to the eurorail when leaving. The centre of paris was close by and the resteraunts and shops by the pompidou centre were authentic. I encourage everyone to visit Les Catacombes what a somber place and the Sciences et de l'industrie for all those with a partner who likes geeky things (he did walk around passages and museums a lot for me). No hesitation to return to paris using this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: deepak2000
Reviews.Content: The strongest point of this hotel is its location. The Metro station was just around the corner and proved to be very convenient for our daily commute. The double room of the hotel had a small balcony overlooking a park. The room was small and the rates were a tad expensive for its size. The bathroom had glazed glass doors, without any lock, and was small as well. Nevertheless, the room was well maintained and clean. The breakfast spread was also good. The most negative point of this hotel is its elevator - the smallest I have ever seen - just 2 people and it is full ! It stopped working when we were checking out and we had to carry all our luggage through the stairs.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and clean. Would stay again.”
Reviews.Author: talltrev
Reviews.Content: I was in Paris with my girlfriend for a long weekend at the beginning of November. I chose Little Palace Hotel because of a nice profile written on it in Conde Nast Traveller magazine a few months ago. I booked online and took the most premium room knowing Paris is infamous for small hotel rooms. When we arrived we were greeted by a very welcoming and friendly front desk agent. She was so very helpful and checked us in quickly and efficiently. She was kind to not switch over to English as we spoke. She let me try out my rusty French on her! When we arrived at the door of our room I was wondering what lay beyond the door (Room 37) …..micro mini room or something indicative of what I expected from my booking….to our very pleasant surprise our room was very large by Paris standards….a suite in fact! Big bathroom with a separate powder room….king size bed and a living room with chairs and a couch. Two TV’s and two mini bars that were even reasonably priced. Breakfast was a bit boring we only took it the first day as it is an additional charge. Didn’t seem like we could get an espresso based coffee so the next few days we had breakfast outside the hotel. The hotel was clean and well kept. I would recommend this hotel and would book again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastique!”
Reviews.Author: phone201
Reviews.Content: We are 3 middle aged women from NYC who just returned from this Heavenly Hotel...It is beautiful, the rooms are clean, and the location is wonderful. The staff is always available to help out with directions, or any requests we had. Although the park below is sometimes noisy, the closed windows cut out any noise. We loved this warm hotel, and will return any time. The rooms are a bit small compared to rooms in America, but European rooms are generally small. I stayed in room 81, which had an amazing view of the Eiffel Tower, and the buildings surrounding the hotel. We had an amazing Thanksgiving in the City of Lights and hope to return again next year.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and easy to get to main tourist attractions”
Reviews.Author: 7kj
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated on a square which overlooks a local playground. The hotel was clean and tidy. The hotel was in a great location to the tourist attractions of Paris. A 15 minute walk to Notre Dame and then onto your other tourist attractions. The only downside is the rooms were very hot due to it being winter and therefore did not allow you to switch the air conditioning on. Other than that, I would recommend this hotel for a weekend break.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kris D
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel,very friendly,very good breakfast,very clean and very good staff!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for sleep”
Reviews.Author: AlyRo85
Reviews.Content: This hotel was picked out for me by my Master's Program director, we went to Paris for Paris Photo. Anyway this place was pretty nice, great beds to sleep on after a day walking around Paris. The breakfast was ok, good for a hotel breakfast and the waiter was nice, the bar was ok, I think because they only have one or two people working the reception desk at night. Anyway this is a nice hotel in a nice area, close to shops and close to restaurants. The rooms are a little small, however it's Europe so things are smaller, also the glass doors to the bathroom are a little awkward as they are frosted, especially when sharing a room with someone you don't really know.

Reviews.Title: “A nice small hotel very conveniently placed”
Reviews.Author: Chris4817
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a 3 star but in the centre of Paris and within easy distance of most attractions and very close to an underground station. We had a room at the top of the building with a small balcony overlooking the park opposite. The rooms are quite small but clean and the staff are very helpful. If I had a couple of small criticisms it's that the walls are very thin and you can hear the televisions of adjoining rooms and even the occupants talking. Also it was quite warm for the time of year when we visited and the air con didn't work and the room was unbearably hot. We left the balcony window open in the night as the road does get quite quiet.

Reviews.Title: “quiet, convenient and great value”
Reviews.Author: gabewong
Reviews.Content: i'm hesitant to write a good review here because i'd like to keep this place a secret because it has so many positives! this is a small establishment right next to the remau sebastopol station and a 15 minute walk to marais/centre pompidou. i stayed for five nights with a friend in a twin room with a balcony that overlooked the park. recently renovated and modern, this is a real gem because its quiet, comfortable and offers great value by paris standards. the front desk staff were friendly and helpful during my stay. i would stay here again anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel....good location, good staff.”
Reviews.Author: laura g
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel 9/13-9/15/2011. Our first time in Paris, we really liked this hotel. It is in a good location, we walked to the Louvre and numerous cafes & shops. The staff is very helpful & pleasant. We used their driver to pick us up at the airport...what a godsend, Lionel is the best driver & a nice person. My partner's mother was with us...he was most considerate , helping her in & out of the car...& whenever he would see us in the hotel, he always had a smile for us. Our room was very nice..clean & comfortable. The bedroom was plenty big, very pretty & the bed comfortable. The bathroom was a nice size & modern. The breakfast offered downstairs every morning was a good way to start the day; coffee, pastries, cold cereal, juice , hard boiled eggs, etc. The hotel is on a quite 1 way street with a park right across the street. There is also a dependable lift in the lobby. We were very happy with our stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice, well-located hotel with friendly helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: Angela M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well-placed for the main attractions of Central Paris - it's about a 15 minute walk to the centre. It overlooks a small park and the rooms near or at the top have wonderful views of the Paris rooftops and the Eiffel Tower - beautiful at dusk. The hotel staff were very helpful and friendly and the breakfast was delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for the short break”
Reviews.Author: SandG017
Reviews.Content: We found the staff very helpful and accomodating . Asked for a room change for a better view . They checked and found another room , commenting it was a little smaller but a great view including a balcony (great view of the tower in the distance) . Very clean and well presented . Buffet continental breakfast plenty of choice and well presented . Metro just around the corner for ease of getting around .

Reviews.Title: “Disabled in a wheelchair and double booked”
Reviews.Author: Gig1964
Reviews.Content: I booked this nhotel with specific instructions for the ground floor wheelchair room. arrived at the hotel and was told that already booked. It was 6pm and they did offer to ring round hotels to find me a room but to be honest I had done that exercise when booking and they are the only ones to have wheelchair room free. I agrred to struggle in the lift using my crutchd leaving chair to charge in hotel lobby. This cause me a lot of pain and discomfort. The staff were excellant and supportive and I cannot critisise their effiency. Room was well decorarated and clean and not a very noisy hotel at all. Again on the downside there were 2 steps upto hotel with door bell out of reach of wheelchair and the ramped they used was too shor so was dangerous to use.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and location”
Reviews.Author: david183
Reviews.Content: A comfortable hotel with good access to the Metro, and easy to get to from Gare du Nord. Exit at Reamur/Sebastopol and the St Papin exit and you are at the square. Room was smallish but perfectly OK, nice shower and clean. Staff excellent. Good view, excellent breakfast. Good value for money. Would happily stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Will not use this again”
Reviews.Author: Leif69
Reviews.Content: Location was fine, within walking distance of Marais nightlife and attractions, plus metro nearby. We had booked a "superior double" but the only superior feature was the balcony, which had a nice view of a park, surrounding historical buildings and the Paris skyline - a good place for morning coffee or a nightcap. But the door to get out there was 50 cm up on the wall, probably prohibitive for many. The room was small and the bed was only 140 cm, too little when one of us is a light sleeper. A curious feature was that the bathroom (including WC) had only shower-type glass doors, so you could see, hear and smell everything going on in there - a little bit too intimate, even for a married couple. In spite of what the hotel's homepage said, there was no coffee machine in the room, so the morning coffee had to be ordered from room service and paid for. When we complained about this and some other things the receptionist was only mildly interested. All in all we were disappointed, considering how much it costs to stay there. We will not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff compensate for the disadvantages of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: tzili
Reviews.Content: We got to the hotel at night and the immediate impresion was that we did a bad mistake. A heavy small of urine wellcomeed us outside of the hotel, it was dark and some homless drunk people were hanging there passing their time breaking empty bottles. In the morning it looked better espwecially if yoy walk to the side of St martin street and not Sebastopol.The staff is excellent. The description of a superior room does not match the room we got: a small badly planned room facing a wall at the back of the hotel. The price is high for a 3 stars hotel in a not so great neighborhood

Reviews.Title: “great location and would recommend”
Reviews.Author: yvrldn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a double room on the 6th floor with a small baloncy with a pleasant view of the square across, the arts and metier museum and near by rooftops - very parisian. we could even see the top of the effiel tower! the lifts are small but the room itself spacious for paris. our bathroom was tiny but the balcony made up for it. we ate nearby and walked to the marais, canal st martin and louvre from here. metros are close by and there are many restaurants to chose from - had great crepes from houblon & sarrasin.

Reviews.Title: “beds were small but staff helpful and good view and location”
Reviews.Author: OhGetOn
Reviews.Content: Our first room, a top floor "suite" at the back, was poky and up in the eaves (couldn't get into the bed on one side). We complained and, the next night were, in a second floor twin room, with very small shower room, at the front of the hotel. This room has a lovely view over the garden square (and is still fairly quiet for central Paris). Staff were kind and helpful and recommended excellent restaurants for petit dejeuner and diner. (We didn't use the hotel for breakfast). I mark this hotel down for the small beds and rather too hard mattresses (i actually prefer a firm mattress) and recommend you book a twin and push the beds together unless you are used a 140 × 200cm double. Otherwise I would recommend the hotel. There is also a cycle (Vélib) hire stand (borne) right outside the front door - very handy for sightseeing and it's only a about 10 minutes walk from the Marais.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, mediocre location for price”
Reviews.Author: Ajm4
Reviews.Content: THE STAFF at this hotel were AMAZING! -One of the men at the front desk worked with me for about 30 minutes to figure out the best evening plans and called and checked availability for me on the Moulin Rogue, Lido and a dinner on the Seine on a Bateaux Mouche ride. Then he booked it for us after spending a lot of time finding the one that fit our schedule and wants (all with a cheerful smile on his face). -They also helped us go online, read french and print out new train tickets when we changed our train reservations. (again this took a long time and they were so helpful and cheerful) -The ROOMS are clean and decent size for french rooms with new clean linens and furniture etc On the BAD SIDE: -The BEDS are of poor quality (you could feel each individual spring) - they look new but are really crappy (and Im young and not picky about beds) -The LOCATIONis ok but not great...it is across the street from a metro stop but that line does not have that many transfer points besides Les Halles which might as well be an underground city so I avoid transferring there when ever possible -It is in the Marias but it isnt close to all of the cool little streets and shops there (its 2 doors in from a main big street). It is walkable to Pompidou and Les Halles but if im be staying near big streets etc (rather than cute parisian streets and small stores in the Marias) I'd rather be closer to Place Concorde/Opera area in fancy big streets rather than blah big streets (maybe that's just me). Its not a bad location but it could be better (depends what youre looking for) sum up: good staff, nice rooms, bad beds, meh location

Reviews.Title: “Impecabile Service”
Reviews.Author: 30inParis
Reviews.Content: Our stay in Paris was for my 30th Birthday. I wanted to soften the blow. lol. The service was amazing. I only know a few words in French, literally. The reception staff was amazing. All friendly, all helpful, all at my beckon call. This hotel was not pricey, I received a room with a balony, nice bathroom (not big by american standards) but all we needed and renovated for about 600 USD for a three night stay. My husband also prearranged flowers and fruits to greet me in the room when we arrived and displayed a nice arrangement. I will agree the elevator is small. But we it was part of our experience. My husband and I and my cousin and his wife mushed ourselves in and took pictures on the ride up. Cute! the Parisian Experience! The hotel was walking distance to the Notre Dame, and there you can pick up the hop on hop off bus tour where essentially we used it as transportation, to get to the Louvre, Champs Elysees, the Effiel, and other sites. There is a Monorix down the street from the hotel for anything you need, pharmacy on the corner and the club Rex. We were late for our reservations twice, once at Dans Le Noir and the other the Four Seasons Le Cinq :) and they called and rescheduled for us AND arranged car service. Beware: I would suggest for you to hale your own cab unless you are mega late. The cab started his meter where ever he left and we paid like 16 euros for a 6 euro trip. Aweful, but i presume not their fault. Thats what we asked for. I would definetly stay there again. I almost forgot, upon arrival as we waited for our rooms to be ready, we were very early, we were served tea and coffee, how chic! This hotel was definetly worth my money. Take it from a teacher from NY. :) Happy travels

Reviews.Title: “Thanks”
Reviews.Author: ParisProd
Reviews.Content: Great personnel, very forthcoming. Justust had a few clients there and everyone loved it. The rooms with balcony on the South side are the Best...

Reviews.Title: “Amazingly friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: TalisVertriest
Reviews.Content: I'm only 21 years old and this was my first paid business trip. Although I have allready a lot of experience with hotels all over the world. The staff was amazingly friendly and they made my stay very comfortable. The breakfast is good, honest products and real french but basic. The beds are very good and the location is excellent. When I saw the prices, it is a little overrated and that is the only reason I wouldn't go there if I had to pay myself. ps: Pitty that the internet is not free.

Reviews.Title: “One of Paris top 30% hotels”
Reviews.Author: johangente
Reviews.Content: Nice and clean hotel with friendly staff. God beds. I will definitely go back here when I need to be in this neighborhood

Reviews.Title: “A nice surprise in Paris"”
Reviews.Author: JAJORI
Reviews.Content: This three-star hotel was quite different to my previous experiences in similar houses in Paris. The location is very pleasant, a bit further away from the busiest quarters of the city, but in the walking distance from them. My hotel room was a DSU with a nice city view over the roofs. The room was surprisingly spacious for a Parisian hotel with a proper bathroom with a bath tube. The staff at the reception was friendly and spoke good English. The continental breakfast was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Good 3-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: Eric87
Reviews.Content: There couldn't really be a downside on this hotel. It has big, spacious rooms, nicely decorated, close to the Metro station (10 m away). Rooms have balconies, I imagine being quite nice during spring or summer. Helpful staff. A minus would be the fact that you need to pay for the WiFi internet access. All in all, I would recommend this hotel, though would not return because I like to change the places I stay in a city if I have the chance to return.

Reviews.Title: “Disaster from top to bottom”
Reviews.Author: DutchMuseChicago
Reviews.Content: I had made a reservation via Priceline for a two night stay in Paris, and was assigned the Golden Tulip Little Palace. When I arrived, I was informed (incorrectly) that Priceline had canceled the reservation, and the hotel was now fully booked. I explained that one is unable to cancel a reservation via Priceline, but the hotel held firm. They sent me to a nearby hotel, still a 10 minute walk in the pouring rain with my luggage, for one night, then instructed me to return to the Little Palace for the second night, which I did. Despite this inconvenience and false information, I did not make a fuss. Late Friday night, I asked the hotel to call for me a taxi to a restaurant, which they did, bragging "We have a contract with a taxi company and can get a taxi when no one else can." Sure enough, one came in 15 minutes. Then, when the restaurant could not get a taxi to take me back (it was 3:30am in Paris and taxis are hard to come by), the restaurant suggested perhaps my hotel could help. I said "Yes, good idea, as they said they had a contract." The waiter came back stating "Your hotel is very rude" and explained the front desk said I should walk (apx 2 miles in a city I do not know well, at 3:30AM.) I phoned them and asked again, personally, if they could help. The person said he would make a call and I should call back. I asked the restaurant to phone back, and they told me he told them it was not his responsibility to help a guest get back to the hotel; only FROM the hotel. I have no problem with the hotel not being able to secure a taxi for me, as they are indeed hard to get late at night on a Friday. But to suggest a guest walk back at basically 4 in the morning for 2 miles in an unfamiliar city is ridiculous, and then after boasting they had a special relationship with a taxi company to say "it is not my responsibility to help him get back" just was too much. OK, so you can't find a taxi, but even the restaurant thought it was rude. So, I checked in, was sent away; and on my last night, was treated rudely. Won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant, welcoming hotel and staff, nice to find in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jtleflaneur
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed the weekend in this small, discrete hotel situated in a non descript area of Paris but walking distance to all major tourist areas on the Right Bank. Virtually equidistant to the Marais/Bastillle area as well as the Opera area. Even closer is the great rue Montergeuil and rue Tiquetonne with excellent trendy restaurants for non tourists. The hotel is about 7 stories with a too small elevator. Rooms are Parisian typical...which means small! Almost no drawer space, but you can hang up your clothes in a closet and place the rest in some open shelving. Breakfast is multi varied but my wife missed a great Croissant. The hotel staff is quite professional and most have been there for years. A veteran staff, not a bunch of kids. English spoken to most guests. Housekeeping is fine, shower good, hot and good pressure. The hotel is on a very quiet side street in between two busy avenues rue St Martin and Blvd Sebastopol. Right across from the hotel is a very small park and the views from the hotel over the park are very pleasant. Try and get a room with this view - don't be afraid of the noise, as there is very little.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Hotel so welcoming”
Reviews.Author: rannveig_10
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Golden Tulip Little Palace with my colleagues and we all enjoyed our stay so much it is a small but so nice Hotel and very good location. You can walk almost every where you go. The rate is not high and the Hotel staff are so nice and willing to make your stay as good as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, decent room”
Reviews.Author: megallenN
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay in this part of the city, Little Palace is a very nice option among inexpensive (by Paris standards) hotels. The room is well maintained (looks recently renovated). Even though the space is limited, its put to good use. You can see the somewhat unique artwork on the walls used for decoration, in the pictures of the rooms provided by the hotel on most booking websites. If you like it, great. I am not a big fan of this style of decoration but the style does not carry over to any of the other furnishings. The window drapes and room furniture are fairly comtemporary looking. So if you can live with those paintings on the wall, rest is all fine. The bathroom is modern as well, and even though small, it is very usable. Some reviewers have mentioned the elevator is small. Its in fact tiny. If you are with your spouse, its fine. Taking it with a business colleague - maybe take the stairs. But the hotel has a small number of rooms and at least when I visited, there was never much of a wait for the elevator. The stairs are right besides the elevator and so except when checking in and out (or otherwise carrying luggage), thats always an available backup for the lower few floors. Very close to two metro stations, both connecting multiple lines. Their driver also provides cab rides to the Orly and Charles De Gaulle airports for a fixed price, which is slightly higher than the cab fare for those routes, but can be charged to your room. There are many shops within walking distance, in case you forgot to pack something. The front desk staff speaks good English.

Reviews.Title: “A 3 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: konkou
Reviews.Content: Close to the center and metro station.Rooms were small but and not very clean ( the floor).Breakfast was basic.Staff was frendly and ready to help you.

Reviews.Title: “NIce Design, but toxic smell”
Reviews.Author: Biagione
Reviews.Content: I looked this hotel up in the web, comparing price, comments and location. The bathroom and the rather small room was very clean, Bathroom was big too, the mattress good. Everything very good life-styly design - and seemed new, like the TV. Unfortunately the room had a terrible strong and toxic smell - and since I was there in December it was not advised to keep the window open. The hotel manager said, there was no particular smell when I was writing him. If that knocking you out-smell would not be there I could recommend the Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “May not be what you want!”
Reviews.Author: JustRelaxGeorgia
Reviews.Content: • This lovely little hotel is a bit away from most of the tourist attractions and too far to walk. You may want to consider a hotel near the Louvre or Place des Pyramides. • The elevator is smaller than your closet. Three persons is a tight fit, one with bags. • The views are very limited, even from the top (8th) floor. • Breakfasts are very expensive, $25, but there are nice restaurants nearby. • The park across the street is a gathering place for really strange people. We would not advise walking nearby at night. • Do NOT order taxis. You will then pay additionally for the taxi from wherever he starts from to the hotel (this could be $30). Better go to the corner and hail a taxi. • Ask for more hangers or you won’t be able to hang all your clothes. They will provide them. • The staff is very pleasant and helpful but provides only the advice you request. • The rooms are very tiny though the bed is large and comfortable. No clothes dresser! • Our room electric went off our last night and was not repaired before we departed. • Look out for the mini-bar prices; they are truly expensive. Some Paris tips: • Some of the tours cost more than they’re worth. Take a taxi to the Sacre Coeur and enjoy one of the many delightful nearby restaurants, many with music and entertainment. Taxis are there to take you back. • The food at the Moulin Rouge is only fair. Better have a great meal at a really good restaurant and then catch the early show, or wait in a very, very long line for the late show. The show is really great. • The Lido continues to be a spectacular show, better than most in Las Vegas. • Do take a cruise on the Seine River‎, especially in the evening to see the lights, but have dinner at a really good restaurant and only a glass of wine on the cruise. You’ll love it! But look at the boats before you buy; some are great and some are old and shabby. You can also have a hop-on-hop-off cruise that stops at many of the attractions and permits you do debark, stay as long as you wish, and catch the next boat, all for a single fare. • The Louvre is not to be missed, but it is so large that you could not visit it all in a week! • Do get a really good Paris map or you will get lost! The free maps are too small and almost illegible or do not show many of the streets which may be very short. • Provide not less than 3 hours before your departure flight. The traffic will crawl and the lines for passport control and security are unbelievable. We made our flight only 5 minutes before departure and ran through the airport! • You will be exhausted when you leave Paris. There is so much to see and it is such an exciting place that you never want to stop moving. And remember, walking can get very tiring. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “NOT GREAT, NOT GOOD and Rather BAD”
Reviews.Author: FashionParis
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Golden Tulip Little Palace in Paris July 5-10, read reviews in advance, it seemed iffy, but not terrible. Having traveled to Paris numerous times I have always been pleased with hotels chosen, unfortunately can not say that about the Golden Tulip Little Palace. To start, DIRTY, yes, DIRTY, carpets, bathroom, all in need of a good scrubbing, had 2 rooms on the 8th floor, both in same state of filth. View fantastic but...Staff poor, no customer service of any sort. Attitude, extremely negative. Best front desk person Koather (red hair) she was sweet, professional and actually cared about the guests, all others, dare I say, SUCKED. When asked to order a taxi, they would forget, when reminded, they where is the taxi, they get on the phone and call for your taxi. Also, taxi info, when the hotel orders you a taxi you are charged from the time dispatch sends them to your location meaning the fare could already be 18 Euro before you even get in the taxi. Yes this is customary, but very excessive dealing with Golden Palace Little Tulip. Ordered the hotels in house driver for trip to airport at the hotel rate of 55 Euro, confirmed and re-confirmed with front desk only to have a taxi waiting for me with the fare already at 20 euro, this was extreme nasty. I could of hired an outside car service and the entire fare would have been 55 Euro instead of the 80 Euro I ended up forced to pay. location of the Golden Tulip Little Palace was dicey, Rue Blondel is the place for prostitutes, which is around the corner, nothing I was interested in but there you are. Did not feel safe alone in the area. Close to the Metro, but no direct routes to Louvre, Arch de Triumph, etc, you have lots of train changing. I would never recommend, or stay at this hotel again, please RUN, do not waste your money.

Reviews.Title: “Good regular hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: rakibey
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights at the Golden Tulip on a long weekend. We booked an Executive room, and stayed on the 6th floor. We were so lucky to have a balcony where we could sip a Chardonnay in the evening. Try to get a room with balcony (Only available on 6th floor I think). The hotel is a regular nice hotel. Nothing special, but fresh and nice. Hotel quality in Paris is very poor in general is my impression, so this is a good deal. The location is good, and you can walk a few minutes to your nearest cafés and enjoy your Espresso. You can also easily walk to the Champs Elysee and other great areas. Good things: Nice and English speaking reception desk A good an central location. Daily cleaning Good price Nice and different decor Not so great: The towels and linens is clean, but very old. On almost all linens or towels there was black spots, but seemed clean and fresh. Changed every day. The walls between the rooms are paper-thin. You can hear your neighbour caugh. There is no real door to bathroom, and since room is so small, a bathroom visit can be annoying When you check out, be careful when you leave your luggage in storage. We had our luggage (including laptops etc) stored, and when we wanted to claim them back, we were told to go get the items that belonged to us ourselves. We could have taken more items that we had and the other guests could have taken ours. That is NOT okay. So be careful about this. The cheapest site we found to book this hotel was Venere.com, and we paid 160 EUR per night for the Executive Room. But in general I would definately recommend this hotel. For dinner, I would recommend you to go to Buddha Bar or Kong. Nice, cool restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Noisy & unclean rooms. Unfriendly staff. Good breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: MassR
Reviews.Content: Nice building, nice hall, nice breakfast room. Tiny and unclean room, unfriendly staff. My room was on the first floor and not only could I hear the noise from the staircase and the elevator all night but also from the receptionist himself, who kept shouting on the phone until 1:30AM and back again from 5:00AM! Also, my room only had one tiny window with view on the tiny inyard which smell awfully bad. Luckily, the breakfast was one of the best I ever had but this did not help recover from the awful night I spent there.

Reviews.Title: “Great, affordable place to stay while in Paris!”
Reviews.Author: ntwkstudent
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently returned from Paris on vacation after spending 4 nights at this hotel. Overall the hotel is a very good value for a 3 start hotel. The rooms were very clean, but small or "cozy". Although we didn’t spend much time in the hotel other than to sleep and get ready for the day we were constantly bumping into each other as there was very little place to store our luggage. The bathrooms contained no tub, just shower and were also small; it was hard to fit more than 1 person in the room without knocking something over like the wall hairdryer or towel rack (my wife and I are of avg size). I would recommend this place if you looking for a nice clean place to stay with a great location. The hotel is in a safe neighborhood next to a number of great little cafes (we loved El Capitole, two blocks walk). We didn’t check out the breakfast in the morning, but it looked very good peaking in, the price was 15 Euro P/P. The beds were a little on the harder size, but comfortable. The staff was also very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel/great location”
Reviews.Author: AthensGATraveler
Reviews.Content: I just returned from Paris having led a group of 11 there with Go Ahead Tours; we joined another 10 Americans there. I'm a very healthy, active 50 yr old woman with an adventuresome spirit, but many of the people I traveled with are not so active in general and have not traveled very much overseas. That being said, this hotel worked perfectly for all of us. Perhaps if you are used to traveling in very high style, you'd have problems with this hotel, but I'm a Rough Guide/Rick Steves' hotel type of traveler and this hotel was excellent (I've made 6 trips to Europe in the last 7 years and stayed in various types of 1-3 star hotels in France, Italy, and England). The room was clean and roomy (for Paris hotels) with a great little shiny bathroom (lots of towels, shampoo, etc) and a beautiful view out to the square in front of the hotel, which seemed quite safe and which amused me endlessly as I sat in the room resting in the late afternoon. There was frig bar in each room; although I didn't take anything from it, it worked out great for keeping my pieces of cheese and jus d'orange. The staff were all courteous and helpful; many were quite friendly. The breakfast was great (lots of choices from yogurt, fruit, and cereal, to croissants and hard boiled eggs and meats and cheese). In the evening, there was a little bar area, more like a hotel living room, in which you could have a drink, coffee, or tea. In terms of the location, again I could not imagine something better -- the Pompidou Center and the heart of the Marais are a 10-minute walk away. One of the best market/cafe streets, the rue de Montegreuil, is about 5-10 minutes in a slightly different direction. There are two metro stops within minutes of the hotel. Someone in a review below complained of the location and its safety, a comment that seems ridiculous having just returned 6 days ago from this hotel. Perhaps this person lives in a gated community and never has been in a walking city. Can not imagine a better place from which to explore Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location and Comfortable Beds !”
Reviews.Author: nekothetravelingcat
Reviews.Content: Just returned from an 8 day trip to Paris. Stayed at the Golden Tulip Little Palace Hotel. Loved it and will definitely want to stay there again ! Pluses: It is centrally located in the Northern Marais area on a small quiet street. It's 2 short blocks away from a Monoprix (grocery and dept store) as well as the Reamur Sebastopol, Line 3 Paris Metro stop. The Arts & Metiers Museum and the Pompidou Center are also in easy walking distance, as well as the sights and sounds of the Marais ! It was great coming back to a quiet, very comfortable, well maintained hotel after very hectic days of sight seeing ! Our room also had a balcony with a view of the park directly across the street. Minuses: Walls can be a bit thin, and they tried to charge us for a breakfast that we didn't eat, during checkout. Breakfast at the hotel was expensive at 13 Euros, so we had our petit dejeuner elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Little Palace, Little to say”
Reviews.Author: Paps-n-Verne-a-Go-Go
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Little Palace for only two days in July, so the location worked against us for the short period of time we had to explore Paris. It is situated at the very top of the Marais district and is not really walking distance to anything if you consider all the walking one does in Paris. It is directly off the Reaumur - Sebastopol stop on the Metro, so transportation was not a problem unless you were out after the Metro stopped running. Then the cabs were rather expensive and the only way back to the hotel. The neighborhood itself is pretty dead after 7pm. All in all, we would have preferred to be more centrally located. The hotel itself was adequate and the staff was very pleasant. The room was nicely decorated and the bathroom was ok. This isn't a posh hotel and the price certainly dictates that. We had a rear room on the sixth floor and our view was of the other rooms and the ventilation system. The park across the street from the hotel certainly had its share of shady characters, but we never felt that we were in any danger. We ordered a continental breakfast through room service for both days and it was delivered quickly. The breads were fresh and the coffee was excellent. Other than that, we did not use any of the other facilities in the hotel. When we return to Paris we will most likely stay closer to the Seine around St Germain.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Foxmeister_7
Reviews.Content: We had two twin rooms on the 5th floor, front facing with balcony and view over the gardens. It was 30+ degrees outside and the air con was essential. Really nice staff, efficient and organised. The hotel is small and in good repair, convenient for the Metro and not too far to walk to many sights. Plus the Eurostar station is only a few Metro stops away, or 10 mins by taxi. This was my third visit to Paris in 25 years and I was surprised how many more rough sleepers/tramps there were. I would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Paris Is a city of monuments”
Reviews.Author: anthony_rat
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice, clean and air conditioned. The best part was the location, 20 mins walk from Notre Dame, Seine and many more tourist attractions, shops, cafe's etc. We didn't really spend much time in the hotel, as we only stayed 5 nights. We had no complaints. The bathroom was large and the bedroom roomy. The only fly in the ointment was the wardrobe size, just a little bit on the small side for a couple, but not worth moaning about. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone. Anthony + Pauline

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel Experience Ever”
Reviews.Author: stinestar74
Reviews.Content: I will never stay at this hotel again; it was the worst hotel experience I have ever had. First, the hotel's website has gross inaccuracies. The site claimed there is room service, but a breakfast is the only room service available. I have never stayed in such a filthy hotel. Our first room had so much dust, we had to take benedryl every night to keep from coughing. The carpets were stained everywhere. There was a roach in the first room, prompting us to get another room. The second room also had stained carpet, was extremely dusty, and had flies and spiders. The mini bar was warm, with food past its expiration date. The housekeeper, who we found lying on the stairs beside our room, forgot to give us soap. When I called down to the front desk to ask for one bar, the rude staff member told me to come down in 15 to 20 minutes. I had to retrieve my own soap. This housekeeper also made 'half' of our bed when we returned to the room one late afternoon. If safety is a travel concern, especially for families, this hotel is not the place to stay. Although this hotel is labeled as being in 1er, it is really right on the edge of this area. We were in the room each night by 8:30pm, for fear of our safety. The high homeless element walking the streets and inhabiting the adjacent, urine smelling park, was frightening. On leaving the hotel, I had trouble with my bags. The front desk staff member, who was rude during checkout, failed to help me, and watched me struggle while he smoked. I will never stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “great staff”
Reviews.Author: majubaChilliwackB_c
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel , friendly and helpful staff , close to metro .Park across street smells of urine , so don't spend any time there .We nicknamed it pee park . Would recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: KM66027
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel. Great location, helpful staff, good breakfast and a view of Montmartre from the bedroom window. Notre-Dame is a 15 min walk and the Marais is a 10 min walk. 2 subway stations give you acces to 4 lines, so you can get around Paris very easily.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable, little hotel”
Reviews.Author: anglopete
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on the basis of some of the better reviews, with the poor reviews all seeming to be based on booking confusion. I went through an agent and paid upfront as this is usually more of a guarantee and I had absolutely no problems checking-in. Some reviews have said it's not a great location but I disagree - Paris is so spread about that wherever you are you are going to have to travel to see some of the sights and The Metro/RER is fast, reliable and easy to understand for anyone willing to make a little effort. I was visiting the UNESCO offices right across Paris and got there in 20 minute in the morning rush hour. This hotel is just 2 stops from Gare Du Nord, which meant that I was in my hotel room 15 minutes from arriving on the Eurostar, which is great. The hotel is also near the Pompidou centre, Notre Dame, several musuems and the Louvre and a short stroll from the bawdy Rue St Denis for those looking for English or Irish pubs to catch an important game. My hotel room was on the top floor and it's worth requesting one up there despite the slow lift, because I had a wonderful clear view of the Eiffel Tower and a glimpse of Notre Dame and the Hotel de Ville. My room was reasonably sized with a comfortable bed, plasma TV and clean bathroom. It also has a reasonably priced mini bar with beers, orange juice, mineral water and wine. The garden plaza out the front I found quaint, watching people play boules during the afternoon and certainly not seeing it as threatening as some have mentioned in other reviews. The breakfast was acceptable and well-presented, though nothing special and I didn't try the restaurant with so many other options available in Paris. I found the hotel staff very pleasant and welcoming. Overall a very nice hotel, but lacks the 'wow' factor that people might be looking for if on a very special trip, but good value compared to a lot of other Paris hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Beware III !”
Reviews.Author: ICY_8
Reviews.Content: We booked a month ahead to stay 2 nights in this hotel, using the hotel website (Golden Tulip chain). I also telephoned to make very sure of our booking, and spoke to a gentleman whom I believe was the manager - he confirmed we had a superior room with balcony for the nights 9-11 February. When we arrived at about 3pm on Saturday 9 Feb, there were two young girls on reception. Just as we now see had occurred to two earlier reviewers, we were told our room was "unavailable" for that night, but would be ours for the Sunday night. No explanation was offered as to why our room had been given away, nor why we were not forewarned. We could even see at the desk the paper with our confirmed reservation on, taken out of the bookings register. Furthermore, when we asked to speak to the manager, the girls said we could not as "he is at home, he does not work weekends"! They then pointed out that they had no responsbility/accountability, as they were not the manager....Grudgingly, one girl 'phoned a "similar hotel, round the corner" which could take us for that night and we could return on Sunday to the Little Palace. Although inconvenient we tried to be reasonable, and walked to the other hotel. It was not near (1 km away). It was old-fashioned, not very clean, on a very noisy trunk road, and was - unsurprisingly - charged out at half the price. The room smelt of smoke too. We promptly used our mobile phone to book ourselves in for 2 nights at a good, if pricey, hotel in the area we had originally wanted. We returned, on foot with our cases, all the way back to the Little Palace to get in writing their acknowledgement that we were not staying with them and owed them no money, as they had our credit card details. This looks like a scam the manager is running. In 20 years I have never come across this problem before in Paris. I have informed the Golden Tulip, as their group reputation is being tarnished by this hotel's unacceptable behaviour.

Reviews.Title: “beware II”
Reviews.Author: dm214
Reviews.Content: we booked the little palace 4 months in advance. The day before arrival they phoned to say something had gone wrong and we could not come. They also said they could not find us anything else. Wedding aniversary trip ruined. Book the little palace if you want to sleep in the park. Disgusting.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Angela45
Reviews.Content: A friend and I visited Paris in November and stayed at the Little Palace Hotel and found it delightful. It is a small hotel which gives special services. It is right off Rue Serbasterpol and easy to find. It is a bit of a walk to some of the museums (there was a transit strike on when we were there and taxis were scarce). The rooms are spotless and the view from the balcony is delightful. The little park out front has children playing in the afternoon and their voices are delightful...the other side of the park has a ping-pong table and some benches...no sign of homeless when we were there. I would recommend this hotel if the metro is running.

Reviews.Title: “good quality for Paris”
Reviews.Author: j75fr
Reviews.Content: - rooms renovated - clean - quiet - good situation

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to visit paris”
Reviews.Author: WimLeuven
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for the third time in 6 years and frankly i don't know what's wrong to this place. It's a well run hotel, friendly, good breakfast and for the location : next to a subway that can bring you everywhere and only a 10 minute walk to Centre Pompidou and Les Halles and all of the vivant Marais district. We had a spacious room for Paris standards, everything clean. No complaints. It's worth its star raiting and for the third time we where happy to be there, for me best place to be in Paris, will return for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, not a great location”
Reviews.Author: casinoroyale
Reviews.Content: The hotel is clean and basic - but the location is too far out for what we wanted. It was right in the fashion wholesale district which was useless for us. The staff were friendly the rooms and bathroom were clean, the bed comfy. It was a good walk to anywhere! It was good value for Paris prices - perhaps that is so because of the location. It does have a pretty park right opposite, but it had some unusual characters roaming about - not my kinda park!.

Reviews.Title: “Beware”
Reviews.Author: many_adventures
Reviews.Content: Beware. We booked a suite for 3 nights directly with the hotel six months in advance. We were travelling with our 14 year old son and needed a room large enough to accommodate 3 people, which is very difficult to find in Paris. When we arrived to check in we were told by Monsieur Ali at Reception that there was a "problem" with the suites and that none of them were available. The alternative was two rooms at opposite ends of the corridor - not suitable as we did not want our son in a room by himself. We explained this to Monsieur Ali and asked him to explain exactly what the problem was with the suites. He was very rude and evasive but after having a stand up argument with him he told us that the suite was already occupied and would not be available for 2 of the 3 nights of our stay. We then asked him to find us alternative accommodation. He refused to do this. By this time it was early evening, and having no alternative accommodation we spent the first night in a small cramped room with a roll away provided for our son. The suite did become available the next day but the whole situation by this time had left us feeling very disappointed with the hotel. The staff at reception remained unhelpful and rude during our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: brooklin0316
Reviews.Content: My mom and I just returned from Paris and enjoyed our stay at the Little Palace Hotel. The staff was extremely helpful and pleasant. There is the issue with the park across the street with homeless men living there. And yes, they do tend to get a bit loud at each other. But never once did they show any disrespect to people passing by. Our room faced the park, so when in the room I viewed their behavior. Another reviewer mentioned stale urine smell coming from the park. News flash.....all of Paris smelled like stale urine. The hotel was very clean and convenient to all the attractions. The rooms were a bit tiny, but comfortable. I would recommend the Little Palace Hotel to anyone visiting Paris. I surprised my mom with this trip to see Il Divo in concert at the Paris-Bercy. I had the tickets sent to the hotel. I didn't know the tickets were being sent registered mail. I happened to use my husbands credit card to purchase the tickets. My husband did not join us on this trip. The post office would not release the tickets to me, only the person to whom the letter was addressed. Even though I had all documentation and proof what was in the envelope. Since there was the language barrier, it was very difficult for me to communicate with the postmaster. The young gentleman at the front desk of the hotel was an enormous help. He spent so much time being my personal translator and never once seemed annoyed. I did get the concert tickets and only by my husband faxing over a letter to the postmaster stating his permission to give me the envelope. The whole episode was a nightmare, but could have been worse if not for the Little Palace Hotel's staff member. Jennifer Freehold, NJ

HotelInfo.Name: Golden Tulip Little Palace
HotelInfo.Address: 4 rue Salomon de Caus, 75003 Paris, France
